title: U.S. aluminum premiums soar 155%, hitting a record high, as tariffs escalate costs
summary: The U.S. aluminum premium surged by 155% to a record high, with buyers paying $4,792 per ton due to a 50% import tariff and structural global supply shortages. The tariff cost alone rose to $1,425 per ton, more than doubling from earlier in the year, intensifying market tensions especially due to disrupted supply from Canada.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Aluminum prices fell slightly to $2,853.35 per ton on November 14, 2025, down 0.90% from the previous day, but remain up over 7% year-over-year. Prices recently eased from a three-year high amid soft manufacturing PMIs in the US and China, though supply concerns keep prices elevated.

title: Aluminum's Tug-of-War: Localized Weakness Meets Global Bullishness Amidst Shifting Market Dynamics
summary: Despite localized industrial weakness and inventory concerns, aluminum prices showed a robust upward trend, trading around $2,881.15 per ton with a 4.92% increase over the past month. The market is driven by tightening supply, strong demand from growth industries, and China's production policies, creating a complex but bullish environment.

title: Trump's Tariffs Send U.S. Aluminum Prices to Record Highs
summary: U.S. aluminum prices hit a record $4,816 per ton due to tightened inventories and tariffs doubling to 50%. The U.S. remains dependent on imports, mainly from Canada, whose shipments have fallen sharply amid trade tensions, causing inventory shrinkage and premium price surges.

title: Aluminium Prices Are On The Rise As US Premium At Record High
summary: U.S. aluminum premiums have increased by 155% since January 2025, pushing consumer prices to $4,790 per ton, while global prices also reach near three-year highs. The rise is driven by supply constraints and tariff impacts, with China focusing on preventing overcapacity in metal production.

title: Alcoa: High US Aluminum Prices Offset Trump Tariff Costs
summary: Alcoa reported that rising U.S. aluminum prices have more than compensated for the $69 million tariff costs incurred from Canadian imports. The U.S. Midwest premium has jumped 113% since early June due to tariffs, with further tariff costs expected to increase in Q4 2025.

title: Aluminium rod production cut wave hits
summary: Nearly 800,000 tonnes of aluminium rod production capacity in China is undergoing concentrated maintenance shutdowns in November 2025 due to persistent inventory buildup and funding pressure. Production cuts aim to reduce in-factory inventory, alleviate funding pressure, and improve cash flow amid weaker downstream demand and high aluminium prices. This wave of cuts may mark a turning point for structural optimisation in the industry.

title: Aluminum's Tug-of-War: Localized Weakness Meets Global Bullishness Amidst Shifting Market Dynamics
summary: The aluminum market shows a complex dynamic with localized industrial weakness in sectors and regions, but overall bullish sentiment driven by global supply constraints and strong demand from key growth industries. Despite weak manufacturing PMIs in the US and China, inventory destocking and stabilizing Chinese stocks indicate tightening physical supply, supporting price surges and investor confidence.

title: Inert Anode Aluminum Production: Carbon-Free Future
summary: Inert anode technology is revolutionizing aluminum production by enabling carbon-free processes that could eliminate 400-700 million tonnes of CO₂ emissions annually if widely adopted by 2040-2045. Recent milestones include a commercial-scale 450-kiloampere cell startup at Rio Tinto's Alma smelter. The technology also offers productivity improvements, higher purity aluminum, and integration with renewable energy for near-zero lifecycle emissions.

title: US Aluminum Midwest Premiums hit record high - What drives the surge and who bears the cost
summary: US primary aluminum imports dropped in the first half of 2025, partly due to tariffs imposed by the Trump administration, leading to record-high Midwest premiums. The decline in imports and weakening domestic stocks have increased costs for industries like automotive and beverage packaging. Analysts expect a market deficit of 1.8 million tonnes in 2025, driven by reduced Chinese exports and lower production outside China.

title: US aluminum industry seeks export curbs on some scrap material
summary: The US Aluminum Association is calling for export restrictions on certain aluminum scrap materials, including used beverage containers, to strengthen domestic supply. This move aims to reduce reliance on imports and support US manufacturers amid high tariffs and market disruptions. Improved tracking and enforcement mechanisms are also proposed to monitor scrap flows and bolster domestic production.

title: Ball is making investments to increase its production capacity in India
summary: Ball Corporation is investing to expand its aluminum production capacity in India, aiming to meet growing demand and strengthen its market position. This move reflects broader industry trends of capacity growth in emerging markets to support global aluminum consumption.

title: Pioneering Sustainable Practices Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever Lead with Carbon-Free Smelting Technology
summary: Alcoa Corporation, Ball Corporation, and Unilever PLC announced a groundbreaking collaboration introducing the first use of ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in consumer personal and home care packaging. This innovation eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions from aluminum production and represents a significant step toward reducing industrial carbon emissions ahead of COP30.

title: ELYSIS Hits Milestone: First Inert Anode Aluminum Cell
summary: ELYSIS successfully started up its 450 kiloampere inert anode cell at Rio Tinto's smelter in Alma, Quebec, marking the first commercial-scale implementation of this technology. The breakthrough achieves high-amperage aluminum production with no direct carbon emissions from the smelting process while improving worker safety and productivity.

title: Inert Anode Aluminum Production: Carbon-Free Future
summary: Inert anode aluminum production technology eliminates 95% of CO2 emissions while boosting manufacturing efficiency by up to 5% above conventional methods. If the technology achieves 50% market penetration by 2040, it could eliminate 400-500 million tonnes of direct process emissions globally.

title: Emissions-Free Aluminium Smelting Breakthrough Achieved
summary: ELYSIS inert anode technology, developed through a partnership between Alcoa Corporation and Rio Tinto, eliminates CO2 emissions in aluminum smelting while generating oxygen instead. The 450 kA commercial-scale cell represents a revolutionary transformation in industrial smelting with applications across automotive, aerospace, and construction sectors.

title: At COP30: Can-to-Can Recycling Delivers 18% Higher Efficiency and Major Climate Benefits for Aluminium Beverage Cans
summary: Research by Innoval Technology demonstrates that can-to-can recycling increases melt recovery rates by 18% and cuts energy use and greenhouse gas emissions by 15% compared to mixed-alloy recycling. Expanding Deposit Return Systems across the EU and UK by 2030 could deliver an additional 50% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions for aluminum.

title: Steel Rose to 3,053 CNY/T on November 14, 2025
summary: Steel prices rose to 3,053 CNY/T on November 14, 2025, up 0.16% from the previous day. Over the past month, steel prices have increased 1.63%, though they remain 3.93% lower than a year ago. Historically, steel reached an all-time high of 6,198 CNY/T in May 2021.

title: HRC Steel Fell to 853.02 USD/T on November 14, 2025
summary: HRC Steel declined to 853.02 USD/T on November 14, 2025, down 0.23% from the previous day. Over the past month, HRC Steel prices have risen 4.92%, and are up 23.45% compared to the same time last year. HRC Steel recently hit a 15-week high of 857.00 USD/T on November 13.

title: NLMK USA Raises Prices for Hot-Rolled and Cold-Rolled Steel by $50/t
summary: According to Kallanish, spot prices for HRC in the US rose to a new range of $830-865 per short ton on November 13, 2025. NLMK USA announced price increases for both hot-rolled and cold-rolled steel products.

title: Global Steel Markets Show Mixed Price Movements in Second Week of November 2025
summary: Global steel markets displayed mixed price movements during the second week of November 2025, with some steel products recording increases while others declined. The varied performance reflects ongoing market volatility across different regions and product types.

title: Iron Ore Futures Plummet Amidst China's Faltering Steel Demand
summary: Iron ore futures have dropped significantly due to weak steel demand in China, pushing contracts to multi-month lows and signaling a structural shift in the global steel market. Chinese steel mills are cutting production to manage losses amid oversupply concerns, while environmental restrictions and a property sector downturn further constrain output. Globally, trade tensions are rising as regions like Europe plan to reduce tariff-free steel imports to protect domestic producers.

title: China October crude steel output slides on weather-led restrictions, lower margins
summary: China's crude steel production in October declined due to weather-related production restrictions and reduced profit margins. These factors contributed to a slowdown in steel output, reflecting ongoing challenges in the Chinese steel industry amid environmental and economic pressures.

title: Global coking coal exports drop slightly in Jan-Sep 2025 on weak steel market sentiment
summary: Global crude steel production fell 1.6% year-on-year to 1.37 billion metric tons in the first nine months of 2025, leading to a slight drop in coking coal exports. Challenges such as increased costs, stricter regulations, and longer approval timelines are slowing new coal projects, while steelmakers are drawing on inventories amid anticipated steel output cuts. Despite a weak steel market, supply concerns in the coking coal sector persist due to regulatory interventions and production tax credits.

title: Can Tata Steel make Vande Bharat's wheels? MD says a business case is a must
summary: Tata Steel's Managing Director highlighted the company's capability to produce strategic steel products like railway wheels but emphasized that economic viability is a key challenge. The company plans to increase production capacity for wheels to meet Indian Railways' projected demand of 200,000 wheels by 2026, with a new plant phase expected to start by FY27. Tata Steel also produces specialized steels for automotive and hydrogen transfer applications.

title: Latin America will face a decline in steel industry in 2025
summary: Steel production in Latin America is forecasted to decline by 2.5% year-on-year by the end of 2025. The region's steel industry is expected to face significant challenges leading to this contraction, reflecting broader global trends of weakening steel demand and production adjustments.

title: COP30 Evening Summary – November 14
summary: Day 5 of COP30 highlighted major advances in steel technology and sustainability, including the adoption of the Belém Declaration on Global Green Industrialization and new interoperability agreements among global steel standards covering 70% of world production. These agreements aim to create a global market for near-zero and low-emissions steel, with independent verification and common carbon intensity data. Maersk also announced plans for 41 methanol-enabled vessels and large-scale green methanol offtake agreements starting in 2026.

title: US Steel outlines $14B domestic investment plan with Nippon Steel
summary: U.S. Steel, backed by Nippon Steel, unveiled a $14 billion investment plan focused on domestic manufacturing, R&D, and product innovation through 2028. The plan includes facility upgrades, new direct reduced iron and electric arc furnace projects, and aims to protect and create over 100,000 jobs. The partnership also targets $2.5 billion in annual synergy benefits by 2030 through operational efficiencies.

title: Copper fell to 5.04 USD/Lbs on November 14, 2025, down 0.21% from the previous day
summary: Copper prices hovered near two-week highs above $5 per pound due to improved demand outlook after the US government shutdown ended. However, prices fell slightly amid reduced bets on a Federal Reserve rate cut and weak trade data from China, including a 1.1% fall in October exports and slowing import growth. Speculation about China's potential stricter controls on copper smelting projects could support prices in the future.

title: Comex Copper Ends the Week 2.26% Higher at $5.0495 — Data Talk
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for November delivery gained 11.15 cents per pound, or 2.26%, closing at $5.0495 this week, reflecting a positive weekly performance in copper prices.

title: Copper market price surges with 'animal spirits' reawakening
summary: Copper prices surged due to supply disruptions, declining ore grades, and rising demand, pushing prices toward $19,000–$22,000 per tonne. The International Copper Study Group revised down its 2025 mine production growth forecast citing major mine incidents. A shift to a refined copper deficit is expected in 2026, driven by constrained copper concentrate availability and lack of shovel-ready investments.

title: Fed Expectations Weigh on Gold
summary: Copper prices moved lower in line with broader risk-off sentiment as markets reduced bets on a December Federal Reserve rate cut. Weak economic data from China, including slow factory output and retail sales growth, weighed on demand. On the supply side, copper production showed mixed results with increases in Peru and BHP’s Escondida mine but declines at Codelco and Collahuasi, supporting near-term copper prices.

title: Why copper is 'a ticking time bomb for explosive price action'
summary: Copper prices have surged by up to 44.5% since the end of 2024, driven by a likely persistent structural supply deficit and rising demand forecasts. Prices reached record highs in mid-2025 but dropped after US tariffs on processed copper were announced. Market dislocation is expected to continue until tariff decisions are finalized, limiting downside risks for copper prices in the coming year.

title: Copper retreats on weak China data, US caution
summary: The London Metal Exchange three-month copper price declined 0.45% to $10,906.5 per tonne amid weak economic data from China and cautious sentiment in the US. Despite the drop, copper was set for a 1.53% weekly gain, reflecting mixed short-term market dynamics.

title: Key facts: Rio Tinto shares dip on copper price drop; signs wind deal
summary: Rio Tinto shares dipped following a drop in copper prices but the company signed a 15-year power purchase agreement for 78.5 MW of wind energy to power its Kennecott copper operations in Utah, signaling a commitment to sustainable mining practices amid market fluctuations.

title: Central Yunnan Nonferrous Metals Achieves 200,000 mt Copper Anode Production Milestone
summary: Central Yunnan Nonferrous Metals exceeded 200,000 metric tons of copper anode production for the first time, marking a significant production milestone. This achievement represents a major accomplishment in the company's copper refining operations.

title: Taseko Mines Swings to Third Quarter Loss Despite Copper Output Gains
summary: Taseko Mines reported increased copper production at its Gibraltar mine in Canada, with output rising to 27.7 million pounds in Q3 2025, despite posting a widened net loss of C$27.8 million. The company forecasts full-year copper production between 100 to 105 million pounds and expects to increase Gibraltar copper head grades and recoveries in Q4.

title: Ivanhoe Electric Secures $200M Bridge Loan for Arizona Copper Mine
summary: Ivanhoe Electric secured a $200 million bridge loan for its Santa Cruz copper project in Arizona, which is designed to produce 72,000 tonnes of pure copper cathodes annually. The project is expected to begin copper cathode production in late 2028 with an estimated after-tax NPV of $1.4 billion.

title: Border States Commodity Update — November 2025
summary: Copper prices reached new highs on the London Metal Exchange following a U.S.-China trade deal, with prices surging over 25% this year. However, copper supply disruptions are intensifying due to incidents at key mines, with the International Copper Study Group expecting production to drop by 150,000 metric tons in 2026.

title: Grasberg Mine Suspension Creates Major Copper Production Crisis
summary: The Grasberg mine suspension following a tragic underground incident has cut 591,000 tons of copper capacity, with Q3 2025 production declining to 912 million pounds from 1,051 million pounds in Q3 2024. Copper prices reached 15-month highs of $10,485 per metric ton as markets recognized the significance of removing nearly 600,000 tons of annual production capacity.

title: AI Boom Pushes Copper Toward a Supply Crunch, BNEF Warns
summary: A new BloombergNEF report highlights that the rapid expansion of AI data centers is significantly increasing copper demand, potentially adding 400,000 tonnes annually. Combined with ongoing energy transition projects and fragile mine supply, this could push copper prices to $13,500 per tonne by 2028, raising concerns about a looming supply crunch.

title: Green Transition Ignites Demand While Supply Scarcity Fuels Volatility
summary: Recent market trends show that the global energy transition is driving strong copper demand, while supply constraints are causing price volatility. The article emphasizes the need for accelerated investment in sustainable mining, recycling, and innovative technologies to meet future demand and secure ethical supply chains.

title: Copper: Wired for the Future
summary: Copper is central to the clean energy transition, with demand projected to reach 61% of global energy use by 2040. The article discusses the supply and demand imbalance, the importance of investment in sustainable mining, and the role of M&A activity in securing future copper supplies.

title: Copper Ore Concentrate & Gold Copper Concentrate 2025
summary: Technological innovations in copper concentrate processing are driving sustainability, with closed-loop water systems, reduced emissions, and improved tailings management. Satellite technology and digital solutions are also enhancing efficiency and transparency in mining operations.

title: Nickel prices fell sharply on November 14, as concerns over the US Fed's hawkish stance triggered cautious market sentiment
summary: Nickel prices dropped sharply on November 14 amid concerns about the US Federal Reserve's hawkish monetary policy, which led to cautious sentiment in the market. The decline reflects broader macroeconomic worries affecting commodity prices.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel prices fell to 14,880 USD/T on November 14, down 0.53% from the previous day, with a 1.78% decline over the past month. The market remains oversupplied, especially due to increased output from Indonesia, and prices are significantly lower than last year.

title: Live Nickel Price per Metric Ton in USD
summary: The live nickel price per metric ton in USD is updated continuously, reflecting global market movements. Prices are influenced by EV battery demand, stainless steel output, and supply from Indonesia and the Philippines.

title: The Market In Numbers - 15 Nov 2025
summary: Nickel prices showed a slight decline on November 15, with a 0.06% drop, continuing a trend of weakness over the past week and month. The broader market remains cautious amid ongoing oversupply concerns.

title: FLASH: Indonesia restricts new nickel smelters to boost value-added production
summary: The Indonesian government has issued a regulation limiting the development of new nickel smelters, focusing on shifting investments from semi-finished nickel products to higher value-added finished products such as raw materials for electric vehicle batteries. This policy aims to support nickel prices and strengthen the domestic downstream processing industry.

title: Energy Minister Tim Hodgson highlights Canada Nickel's Crawford mine
summary: Canada Nickel's Crawford mine in Ontario is being fast-tracked for approval as a major project, with a projected lifespan of over 40 years and potential to become one of the top 10 nickel producers globally. The project emphasizes low carbon emissions and plans expansions to produce other metals and develop nickel refining and stainless steel production.

title: Fathom Nickel expands Gochager Lake footprint
summary: Fathom Nickel is advancing exploration at its Gochager Lake Project in Saskatchewan, Canada, with promising soil geochemistry and rock assay results indicating potential for a significant nickel district. The company is preparing for a drilling campaign supported by winter conditions and infrastructure development.

title: Lifezone Metals raises US$15 million to advance work on Kabanga nickel project
summary: Lifezone Metals has launched a $15 million direct share offering to fund advancement of its Kabanga nickel project in Tanzania, aiming to develop one of the world's largest undeveloped high-grade nickel sulfide deposits.

title: Indonesia reopens nickel mine in dive hotspot despite outcry
summary: The Indonesian government has permitted a nickel mining company to resume operations in an eastern archipelago dive hotspot, despite environmental concerns and public outcry. This move reflects Indonesia's ongoing prioritization of nickel production amid global demand.

title: The Future of Nickel Alloy Innovations in Sustainable Manufacturing
summary: Nickel alloy innovations are advancing sustainable manufacturing by improving battery performance and longevity, reducing environmental footprints. New nickel alloys are lighter, stronger, and more corrosion-resistant, contributing to efficiency improvements in aerospace, automotive, and energy sectors. Challenges include cost-effective manufacturing and sustainable raw material sourcing.

title: Canada's Nickel Processing Innovation for Clean Energy
summary: Canada is pioneering sustainable nickel processing technologies that integrate renewable energy, closed-loop water systems, and carbon sequestration to achieve net-zero emissions. Innovations include advanced leaching chemistry, energy efficiency improvements, and circular economy practices such as multi-metal recovery and tailings repurposing. These efforts support clean energy applications and strengthen supply chain security for EV manufacturers.

title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
summary: French start-up Genomines secured $45 million to scale its innovative method of extracting nickel from plants instead of traditional mining. This approach offers higher purity nickel, faster deployment, and lower costs, with ongoing pilot projects involving major automakers. The technology aims to complement traditional mining by providing a cleaner, scalable nickel source.

title: Recycling technology achieves 99% purity of nickel and cobalt from spent batteries
summary: A research team at UNIST developed a novel recycling technology that recovers over 95% of nickel and cobalt from waste batteries with purity exceeding 99%. This electrochemical separation process uses a multifunctional solvent to minimize chemical use and wastewater, offering a sustainable and cost-effective solution for battery recycling.

title: Advancing the US EV battery supply chain with new nickel carbonate agreement
summary: Aqua Metals and Westwin Elements announced a non-binding Letter of Intent to supply up to 1,000 metric tons annually of recycled high-purity nickel carbonate for EV battery cathodes. This collaboration aims to enhance domestic nickel production using advanced refining technologies, supporting a sustainable and secure US supply chain with product delivery targeted for 2027.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started the pilot phase of its green hydrogen production project at its plant in Aosta, Italy. The project uses a 1.008 MW Anion Exchange Membrane electrolyzer to produce 165 tons of green hydrogen annually, aiming to reduce carbon emissions and power one of its 70 furnaces entirely. This initiative is supported by €7.9 million funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has commenced operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy, as part of its efforts to reduce fossil fuel use in steel production. This pilot plant is a key step in the company’s sustainability strategy to cut carbon emissions in its manufacturing processes.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity consumption comes from certified renewable sources. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and long-term value creation, reinforcing its leadership in the Italian steel industry.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali SpA Announces Its Commitment to Sustainability with ResponsibleSteel™ Certification
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has embarked on the ResponsibleSteel™ certification process for its Aosta site, formalizing its commitment to sustainable steel production. The certification reflects the company’s dedication to environmental responsibility, transparency, and social challenges in the steel industry, aiming to create lasting value for employees, customers, and communities.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne sees double-digit revenue and volumes decline in 2023
summary: After a record performance in 2022, Cogne Acciai Speciali experienced a 15% decline in revenue in 2023, reporting EUR 822 million amid a more complex market environment. The company faced challenges leading to decreased volumes and revenues compared to the previous year.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris remains profitable in 2025
summary: Tenaris reported a $37 million profit in Q3 2025, a 15.6% increase from the previous quarter but a 22.9% decrease compared to Q3 2024. Sales in North American oil and gas tubular products remained steady despite some reductions in drilling activity, with margins affected by recent tariff increases on steel imports.

title: Tenaris S.A. Reports Shareholder Update on Ownership Stake and Planned Share Sales
summary: Tenaris's controlling shareholders plan to sell some shares while maintaining at least a 67% ownership stake, in response to the company's ongoing share repurchase program. The timing and amount of sales will depend on market conditions, with no current plans to reduce ownership below 67%.

title: Tenaris to Commence a USD 600 million Second Tranche of its USD 1.2 billion Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris announced the start of the second tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, amounting to $600 million. This tranche will run from November 3, 2025, to no later than April 30, 2026, with trading decisions made by the bank managing the program.

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris released its financial and operational results for the third quarter of 2025, highlighting steady sales and profitability despite market challenges. The report reflects the company's resilience in the steel and energy sectors amid tariff impacts and fluctuating drilling activity.

title: Tenaris S A : Weekly Report (November 10, 2025 - November 14, 2025)
summary: As of November 14, 2025, Tenaris held 33,065,400 ordinary shares in treasury, representing 3.08% of its total issued share capital. This report provides an update on the company's shareholding and treasury stock status during the week.

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel
summary: Italian antitrust authorities have launched an investigation into major low voltage copper cable manufacturers, including Prysmian and Nexans, for allegedly fixing prices since 2005. Inspections were conducted at the offices of companies including Bruno Baldassari & F.lli Spa, General Cavi Spa, Icel Scpa, and others. The investigation caused Prysmian's stock to drop 1.26% and Nexans to fall 1.9%, though analysts believe the impact will be negligible as the Italian low voltage cable market represents less than 3% of Prysmian's revenues.

title: Italian Expertise Fuels Prysmian Innovation
summary: Prysmian announced innovation initiatives as part of its 'Accelerating Growth' strategy, aiming to achieve over 55% growth targets. The company has been appointed to the Green New Deal funded by MIMIT for 2025-2028 R&D activities in submarine energy cable development.
